title: Medlock Ames 2015 Estate Red Bell Mountain Red (Alexander Valley)
description: This is a concentrated wine rich in red fruit that remains light in the glass. Herbal, earthy undertones of oystershell and dill mix with cedar and currant.

title: Merry Cellars 2014 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Vanilla, baking spice, sliced green-pepper and dried cherry aromas are followed by ripe sweet cherry and herb flavors. It finishes with a tart plum and vanilla-filled finish. Bitter notes linger.

title: Opawa 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This could be a poster child for Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc, offering all the hallmarks of the style: white grapefruit, pineapple, passionfruit and peach skins with, of course, a lick of grassiness. Its racy acidity and slightly chalky texture make for an easygoing summer sipper.

title: Podere Volpaio 2011  Chianti
description: Made from organically grown Sangiovese, Canaiolo, Colorino and Malvasia Nera, this opens with earthy aromas of scorched earth, leather and black-skinned berries. The straightforward palate doles out licorice, clove and black cherry jam flavors alongside round tannins. Drink through 2021.

title: Poggio Salvi 2015  Chianti
description: This wine's dark berry and tilled soil aromas emerge from the glass. The easygoing palate delivers black plum, tobacco and white pepper flavors alongside pliant tannins. Drink soon.

title: Qupé 2016 Syrah (Central Coast)
description: A lighter expression of Syrah on both the nose and palate, this bottling starts with aromas of coffee, black currant and a bit of vanilla dust. The palate is fresh and easy but also somewhat simple, without much mouthfeel, structure or bold flavors.

title: Ravoire et Fils 2017 Domaine Bel Eouve Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: Bright and crisp, this attractive wine is spiced with a touch of pepper and plenty of red-berry fruits. It has a good balance, everything in its place. It is ready to drink.

title: River Road 2016 Un-oaked Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: Dark and golden in color, this 100% stainless-steel fermented white is steely on the midpalate, with an integrated, rich thread of vanilla that gives it a tropical tease of sweetness, though the wine finishes dry and defiantly light.

title: Roccafiore 2017 Fiordaliso Grechetto (Umbria)
description: This leads with Spanish broom, acacia honey and dried yellow stone fruit aromas. The honeyed note carries over to the palate, together with mature apricot, pineapple and citrus hints.

title: Sparkman 2016 Apparition White (Yakima Valley)
description: This wine is mostly Roussanne (70%), with the balance equal parts Marsanne and Grenache Blanc, with the fruit coming from Olsen and Boushey vineyards. Lemon verbena, grape-nut, peach and apple aromas lead to broad stone-fruit flavors.

title: Staete Landt 2017 Map Maker Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This is a solidly made, wallet-friendly Sauvignon Blanc that offers heady, fresh aromas and flavors of lemon zest, oregano and snow pea, with a slightly creamy texture to balance all that zingy acidity. Drink now.

title: Taken Wine Co. 2016 Complicated Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Pungent in oak and strong, warm aromas of crème brûlée, this wine offers a lush profile of mango, papaya and baked peach, slightly tropical and rich while being moderately balanced and the right kind of rich.

title: Tenuta Torciano 2016 Poggioaicieli  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)
description: This wine's delicate scents reminiscent of wild flowers and orchard fruit lift out of the glass. The rounded, straightforward palate offers white peach, yellow pear and light bitter almond notes.

title: Terra d'Oro 2017 Rosé (Amador County)
description: This light-salmon-colored wine was made from the unusual combination of Grenache and Nebbiolo grapes. It is light bodied but has substantive qualities like an earthy raspberry aroma and a smooth texture that spreads canteloupe and cinnamon over the palate.

title: Tertulia 2014 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Being 100% varietal, baking spice, dried savory herb, dried tobacco and cherry aromas are followed by plump lighter-styled fruit flavors, with red-fruit and black-tea notes on the finish. The tannic structure is surprisingly light for the variety.

title: The Winery At Holy Cross Abbey 2015 Cabernet Franc (Colorado)
description: Aromas of licorice, brandied cherry, red currant and black pepper show on a nose. This is a solid Cabernet Franc, if slightly over oaked, with juicy flavors of cranberry and pomegranate upfront leading to nutmeg, toasted oak and more black pepper. Tangy, lifting acidity keeps it in balance, with dusty tannins lingering through the oaky finish of muddled cherries and more spice.
winery: The Winery At Holy Cross Abbey

title: Thirsty Owl Wine Company 2016 Doyle Fournier Vineyard Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)
description: Creamed corn, butterscotch and lemon meringue tones carry the nose and palate of this medium-bodied wine. It's soft in feel, with a mild vein on acidity to balance.

title: Tora Bay 2017 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)
description: This is fairly typical in style, focused more on passionfruit and citrus flavors than on the herbal and grassy flavors. Along with all the lemon, passionfruit and stone fruit characters, there's a lick of zingy acidity and a slightly creamy texture, making for an easy-drinking summer sipper.

title: Usiglian del Vescovo 2015  Chianti
description: This easygoing blend of Sangiovese and 10% Cabernet Sauvignon has subdued cooking spice and dark-skinned fruit aromas. The round palate offers black cherry jam, vanilla and star anise flavors alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.

title: William Weaver 2016 Tattoo Girl Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Pale salmon in color, light aromas of watermelon and cherry pie are followed by lightly sweet-seeming strawberry and cherry flavors with a dry finish. It's a straightforward easy drinker.

title: Adolf & Heinrich Fuchs 2017 Skeleton Hárslevelü (Burgenland)
description: A mere whiff of tender lemon freshness appears on the nose. The slender easy palate also benefits from that lemon freshness on its dry finish.

title: Airfield Estates 2015 H. Lloyd Miller Founders Series Red (Yakima Valley)
description: Cabernet Sauvignon makes up 66% of this wine, with the balance 23% Merlot along with smidgens of Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot and Malbec. The aromas bring notes of roasted green pepper, raspberry, clove and cherry, leaning into the green. The dry lighter-styled palate shows more of the same, along with a quite smoky finish. The tannins bring some astringency.

title: Barboursville Vineyards 2015 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Virginia)
description: Grapefruit, white peach, cantaloupe and pilsner aromas follow through to the palate. Bright acidity is matched with a textural creaminess. The finish is demure, with a zip of acidity straight down the middle of the tongue.

title: Bodegas Lacort 2008 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: A light red color and earthy aromas of dried cherry and cinnamon oversell a linear palate that's acidic and pushes hard to the middle. Tomato, red-plum and herbal flavors finish long and narrow on a wood spice note.

title: Breaux 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Virginia)
description: Flint and savory herbs are the stars of this wine, with citrus playing a supporting role. In both aroma and flavor, fennel and bell pepper stand out with grapefruit and a smoky, stoniness on the midpalate. The finish is long and zippy in herbacious tones.

title: Callaghan Vineyards 2013 Buena Suerte Red (Sonoita)
description: Savory aromas of brandied cherry, cedar, licorice and vanilla open on the nose. The palate shows riper fruits in tones of raspberry and plum, with flavors of clove, oak and more vanilla. Gentle, dusty tannins lend structure to the palate, while a healthy vein of acidity keeps the fruit flavors juicy. Red cherry lingers on the finish with an undercurrent of leather.

title: Casa alle Vacche 2015 Crocus Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)
description: This mature white has a rather shy nose, but the medium-bodied palate offers toasted almond, pineapple and dried yellow stone fruit flavors. An almond note and a hint of dried sage give it a bitter finish.

title: Castello Sonnino 2016 Sonnino  (Chianti Montespertoli)
description: This wine's wild berry, crushed herb and leather aromas lift out of the glass. The bright, light-bodied palate offers ripe red berry, powdered sage and clove hints set against firm, dusty tannins that leave a somewhat astringent finish. Drink through 2019.

title: Castelvecchio di Filippo Rocchi 2015 Santa Caterina  (Chianti)
description: This wine's dark berry and baking spice aromas emerge from the glass. The linear, no-frills palate offers crushed plum and star anise flavors alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.

title: Castelvecchio di Filippo Rocchi 2016 Santa Caterina  (Chianti)
description: This opens with dark-skinned fruit and underbrush aromas. The easygoing palate offers black cherry, white pepper and clove flavors alongside pliant tannins. Drink soon.
